decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to efficiently utilize graveyard resources and quickly reanimate powerful creatures. The deck achieves this by utilizing cards like Mulch, Grisly Salvage, and Tracker's Instincts to fill the graveyard with creatures. It then uses Unburial Rites to bring back a powerful creature like Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck also includes cards like Lingering Souls and Avacyn's Pilgrim for early game board presence and acceleration. Additionally, the deck includes mana fixing lands and mana dorks like Arbor Elf and Somberwald Sage to ensure consistent ramp and color availability.

The main concept of this Jeskai Aggro deck revolves around utilizing efficient creatures like Geist of Saint Traft and Restoration Angel, along with powerful spells like Thundermaw Hellkite and Searing Spear, to quickly overwhelm and defeat the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Azorius Charm, Dissipate, and Essence Scatter to control the game and protect its key threats. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Snapcaster Mage and Thought Scour allows for flexibility and the ability to efficiently use cards in the graveyard. The overall strategy is to apply pressure early and maintain control of the battlefield to secure a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Rakdos Cackler, Bloodthrone Vampire, and Falkenrath Aristocrat. Additionally, cards like Mark of Mutiny and Brimstone Volley can help to deal extra damage and control the board. The inclusion of Blood Artist and Geralf's Messenger adds further pressure on the opponent while Gravecrawler provides recurring threats. With a strong mana base including Cavern of Souls and dual lands like Blood Crypt, this deck aims to quickly build a board presence and outpace the opponent in a fast-paced match.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive Zombie creatures while utilizing cards like Mark of Mutiny to gain control of opposing threats and exploit them to our advantage. The deck also includes cards like Blood Artist and Bloodthrone Vampire to capitalize on sacrificing our own creatures for value. The mana base is built to support the aggressive nature of the deck, with a mixture of lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, board wipes, and card draw. It aims to stabilize the board, generate card advantage, and outvalue the opponent through efficient removal and powerful threats like Thragtusk and Sphinx's Revelation. The deck is designed to outlast aggressive strategies and grind out incremental advantages until it can establish a dominant position. With a mix of control elements and versatile threats, it seeks to outmaneuver opponents and emerge victorious through strategic decision-making and resource management.

This Jund Control deck focuses on utilizing a mix of removal spells, powerful creatures like Huntmaster of the Fells and Thragtusk, and planeswalkers like Garruk, Primal Hunter to control the game and outvalue opponents. The deck also includes cards like Deathrite Shaman and Olivia Voldaren to disrupt opponents' strategies and generate incremental advantages. By controlling the game with removal and powerful creatures, the deck aims to grind out opponents and win through superior card advantage and board presence.

The key concept of this Jund control deck is to gain advantage through powerful creatures and removal spells. The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Huntmaster of the Fells, Thragtusk, and Olivia Voldaren to generate value while also controlling the opponent's board with spells like Dreadbore and Mizzium Mortars. The deck also utilizes planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Vraska the Unseen to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to dominate the board and grind out value over the course of the game.

The key concept of this deck is to apply aggressive pressure on the opponent using a combination of creatures and spells. The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures like Delver of Secrets and Geist of Saint Traft to establish an early board presence. It also includes cards like Restoration Angel and Azorius Charm to generate additional value and control the opponent's board. The deck uses cards like Snapcaster Mage and Thought Scour to maintain card advantage and flexibility in casting spells. Additional spells like Dissipate and Essence Scatter provide disruption and protection. The inclusion of Runechanter's Pike allows for increased damage output, while Unsummon provides additional tempo advantage.

The main idea of this Azorius Aggro deck is to quickly build up a board presence with low-cost creatures like Champion of the Parish, Knight of Glory, and Precinct Captain, while utilizing cards like Silverblade Paladin and Sublime Archangel to give them extra power and evasion. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben helps to disrupt opponents' strategies, while cards like Geist of Saint Traft and Fiend Hunter provide opportunities for removal. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures and efficient combat tricks to secure victory.

This Azorius Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive creatures like Champion of the Parish, Geist of Saint Traft, and Precinct Captain. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Silverblade Paladin and Sublime Archangel to boost its creatures and push for damage. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben helps to disrupt opponents' strategies, while cards like Faith's Shield provide protection for key creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and efficient creature-based strategy while utilizing some control elements to stay ahead in the game.

The deck focuses on filling the graveyard with creatures using cards like Mulch and Grisly Salvage, then using cards like Unburial Rites to bring them back onto the battlefield. Lingering Souls and Tracker's Instincts provide additional creature options while mana dorks like Arbor Elf and Avacyn's Pilgrim help ramp into big threats like Craterhoof Behemoth. Deathrite Shaman can disrupt opponents' graveyard strategies. The deck aims to quickly reanimate powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures for a game-winning attack.

This Jund Control deck focuses on using powerful removal spells and versatile threats to keep the opponent's board in check while generating card advantage. By playing a mix of efficient removal spells like Dreadbore and Bonfire of the Damned, alongside resilient threats like Huntmaster of the Fells and Thragtusk, the deck aims to control the game until it can end it with big finishers like Thundermaw Hellkite and Rakdos's Return. With value-generating cards like Garruk, Primal Hunter and Olivia Voldaren backing up its removal suite, the deck is designed to outlast and outgrind its opponents.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures. It focuses on playing efficient creatures like Thragtusk, Loxodon Smiter, and Armada Wurm, supported by cards like Silverblade Paladin and Sublime Archangel to enhance their effectiveness. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and removal spells like Oblivion Ring and Selesnya Charm to control the game. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with mana acceleration from Arbor Elf and Avacyn's Pilgrim, backed up by Gavony Township for added value.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Loxodon Smiter and Strangleroot Geist, supported by mana acceleration from cards like Arbor Elf and Avacyn's Pilgrim. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures, backed up by powerful spells like Selesnya Charm and Rancor. The inclusion of cards like Restoration Angel and Sigarda, Host of Herons provides additional value and resilience. Gavony Township offers a late-game boost to further enhance the deck's aggression. The mana base is designed to support the deck's fast-paced strategy.

The main concept of this Jeskai Aggro deck is to quickly and efficiently control the board using counter spells, removal, and card draw, while also utilizing creatures with value like Restoration Angel and Snapcaster Mage. The deck aims to maintain card advantage and board presence through synergy between spells like Azorius Charm and Sphinx's Revelation, as well as utilizing equipment like Runechanter's Pike. By efficiently controlling the game and playing threats that can end the game quickly, this deck aims to overwhelm and outpace opponents in a Standard 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of small creatures, known as "aggro-weenies," in order to quickly build a strong offense and put pressure on the opponent's life total. By utilizing cards like Champion of the Parish, Precinct Captain, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, the deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and then utilize cards like Gavony Township and Riders of Gavony to further enhance the abilities of these creatures and push through for a fast win. The deck focuses on aggressive tactics and efficient use of mana to outpace the opponent.
